info.title: Web API v2 - Public
info.description: Documentation of the public web API.

id.description: The unique numeric ID of the data store. It can be retrieved from the `/data-stores` endpoint.

name.description: The data store name. The name does not need to be unique.

records.description: The number of rows containing data in the data store.

size.description: The size that the data store occupies (defined in bytes).

maxSize.description: The maximum size of the data store (defined in bytes).

teamId.description: The unique numeric ID of the team whose data stores will be retrieved.

datastructureId.description: The unique numeric ID of the data structure related to the data store.

teamId.description: The unique numeric ID of the team in which a data structure will be created.

name.description: The data structure name. The name does not need to be unique.

strict.description: Refers to the "Strict" option available for data structures in the Integromat platform interface. If set to **true**, the data structure will be compared to the structure of the payload and if the payload contains extra items not specified in the data structure, the payload will be rejected.

spec.description: Defines the data structure specifications including all related options. The specification structure depends on the chosen data types.

name.description: The unique numeric ID of the team in which a data structure will be created.

strict.description: Refers to the "Strict" option available for data structures in the Integromat user interface. If set to **true**, the data structure will be compared to the structure of the payload and if the payload contains extra items not specified in the data structure, the payload will be rejected.

spec.description: Defines the data structure specifications including all related options. The specification structure depends on the chosen data types. All properties correspond to the options visible in the Integromat interface.

Blueprint.description: The full blueprint of the scenario or template. It contains information about the general setup and all included apps and modules, and their settings.

PgSortBy.name: pg[sortBy]
PgSortBy.description: The value that will be used to sort returned entities by.

PgSortById.name: pg[sortBy]
PgSortById.description: The value that will be used to sort returned entities by.

PgSortByName.name: pg[sortBy]
PgSortByName.description: The value that will be used to sort returned entities by.

PgOffset.name: pg[offset]
PgOffset.description: The numeric value of entities you want to skip before getting entities you need.

PgSortDir.name: pg[sortDir]
PgSortDir.description: The sorting order. It accepts the ascending and descending direction specifiers.

PgLimit.name: pg[limit]
PgLimit.description: The numeric value of maximum entities to return.

TemplateId.name: templateId
TemplateId.description: The unique numeric ID of the private template. It can be retrieved from the `/templates` endpoint.

TemplateUrl.name: templateUrl
TemplateUrl.description: The unique URL of the public (approved) template consisting of the template ID and name. It can be retrieved from the `/templates/public` endpoint.

TemplatePublicId.name: templatePublicId
TemplatePublicId.description: The unique numeric ID of the public version of the approved template. It can be retrieved from the `/templates` endpoint as one of the following IDs: **publishedId** for all published templates that are waiting for approval or not, or **approvedId** for approved templates.

TemplateUsedApps.name: usedApps[]
TemplateUsedApps.description: The array with the text IDs of the apps used in the templates. This parameter allows you to get only the templates containing specific apps.

ConnectionId.name: connectionId
ConnectionId.description: The unique numeric ID of the connection. It can be retrieved from the `/connections` endpoint.

HookId.name: hookId
HookId.description: The unique numeric ID of the hook. It can be retrieved from the `/hooks` endpoint.

ImtZoneId.name: imtZoneId
ImtZoneId.description: The unique numeric ID of the Integromat zone. This parameter is required to retrieve notifications from the Integromat Next version. In other cases, it can be ignored. The IDs of the zones can be obtained from the `/enum/imt-zones` endpoint.

tags.name: Connections
tags.description: For most apps, it is necessary to create a connection, through which Integromat will communicate with the given third-party service according to the settings of a specific scenario. The following endpoints allow you to create and manage connections.

tags.name: Data Structures
tags.description: Data structures define the format of the data being transferred to the Integromat platform. For instance, they are widely used by the Data stores component. The following endpoints allow you to create and manage data structures.

tags.name: Hooks
tags.description: Hooks refers to the webhooks and mailhooks available in the various apps in the Integromat interface. They notify you whenever a certain change occurs in the connected app or service, such as sending an HTTP request or an email. The following endpoints allow you to create and manage hooks.

tags.name: Notifications
tags.description: The Notifications feature keeps you informed about problems in your scenarios and keep you up to date when it comes to the new features and improvements in Integromat. The following endpoints allow you to manage the notifications.

tags.name: Templates
tags.description: The Templates feature allows you to create and use templates as a starting point for your Integromat scenarios. By default, Integromat offers hundreds of templates containing the scenarios of most-used apps. The following endpoints allow you to create and manage templates.

tags.name: Templates > Public
tags.description: The following endpoints focus on the public (approved) templates that are available to every user regardless of the organization and team.

post.description: Logs a user in by passing the user's email and password in the request body. It does not work with an API token.
Logs the currently logged-in user out. It does not work with an API token.
experimental
experimental

get.description: Retrieve a list of available agents for the given team.
Retrieves a collection of all connections for a team with a given ID. Returned connections are sorted by the name, with the most recently created connections appearing first.

parameters.name: teamId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the team whose connections will be retrieved.

parameters.name: type[]
parameters.description: This parameter allows you to specify the type of the connections to return details for. The connection type is defined in the `accountName` property and you can get it from the `\connections\{connectionId}` endpoint.

parameters.name: cols[]
parameters.description: This parameter allows you to specify the group of values to return. For instance, you may want to check if all retrieved connections are upgradeable.

post.description: Creates a new connection with parameters passed in the request body. As the response, it returns all details of the created connection.

parameters.name: teamId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the team whose connections will be retrieved.

get.description: Retrieves details of a connection with a given ID.

parameters.name: connectionId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the connection. It can be retrieved from the `/connections` endpoint.

parameters.name: cols[]
parameters.description: This parameter allows you to specify the group of values to return. For instance, you may want to retrieve only the scopes for a given connection.

patch.description: Updates a connection with a given ID by passing new values in the request body. Any property that is not provided will be left unchanged. As the response, it returns all details of the updated connection including properties that were not changed.

parameters.name: connectionId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the connection. It can be retrieved from the `/connections` endpoint.

parameters.name: cols[]
parameters.description: This parameter allows you to specify the group of values to return. For instance, you may want to retrieve only the expiration of the updated connection.

delete.description: Deletes a connection with a given ID and returns the ID as the response.

parameters.name: connectionId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the connection. It can be retrieved from the `/connections` endpoint.

parameters.name: confirmed
parameters.description: This parameter confirms the deletion if a connection is included in at least one scenario. Confirmation is required because the scenario will stop working without the connection. If the parameter is not sent or is set to `false` an error code is returned and the resource is not deleted.

post.description: Sets the verification status by passing the *verified* property in the request body. It returns the confirmation if the connection is verified (true) or not (false).

parameters.name: connectionId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the connection. It can be retrieved from the `/connections` endpoint.

post.description: Verifies if a scope for a given connection is set. It returns the information if the connection is scoped (true) or not (false).

schema.description: The array with the IDs of the scopes for a given connection. The scope ID of a specific connection can be retrieved from the `\connections\{connectionId}` endpoint.

parameters.name: connectionId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the connection. It can be retrieved from the `/connections` endpoint.

post.description: Sets data for a connection with a given ID. Data differ depending on the connection type. It returns the confirmation if the connection was changed (true) or not (false).

schema.description: The set of data may be different for each connection type so there are no predefined body properties to use. Please see the request examples for more details.

parameters.name: connectionId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the connection. It can be retrieved from the `/connections` endpoint.

parameters.name: reauthorize
parameters.description: The reauthorization status. If set to **false**, it will show the *Reauthorize* button next to the connection in the Integromat interface. Scenarios containing connections that need reauthorization may not be fully functional.

get.description: Retrieves a collection of all data stores for a team with a given ID. Returned data stores are sorted by name, with the most recently created data stores appearing first.

parameters.name: teamId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the team related to the data store.

parameters.name: cols[]
parameters.description: This parameter allows you to specify the group of values to return. For instance, you can retrieve only the IDs of data stores for a team with a given ID. Besides, this parameter enables you to get more details than can be retrieved from the main request with only the teamId parameter.

parameters.name: pg[sortBy]
parameters.description: The value that will be used to sort returned entities by.

parameters.name: pg[offset]
parameters.description: The numeric value of entities you want to skip before getting entities you need.

parameters.name: pg[sortDir]
parameters.description: The sorting order. It accepts the ascending and descending direction specifiers.

parameters.name: pg[limit]
parameters.description: The numeric value of maximum entities to return.

id.description: The unique numeric ID of the data store. It can be retrieved from the `/data-stores` endpoint.

name.description: The data store name. The name does not need to be unique.

records.description: The number of rows containing data in the data store.

size.description: The size that the data store occupies (defined in bytes).

maxSize.description: The maximum size of the data store (defined in bytes).

teamId.description: The unique numeric ID of the team whose data stores will be retrieved.

datastructureId.description: The unique numeric ID of the data structure related to the data store.

post.description: Creates a new data store with parameters passed in the request body. As the response, it returns all details of the created data store.

name.description: The data store name. The name does not need to be unique.

teamId.description: The data store name. The name does not need to be unique.

datastructureId.description: The unique numeric ID of the data structure included in the data store. All data structures IDs for a given team can be retrieved from the `/data-structures` endpoint.

maxSizeMB.description: The maximum size of the data store (defined in MB).

id.description: The unique numeric ID of the data store. It can be retrieved from the `/data-stores` endpoint.

name.description: The data store name. The name does not need to be unique.

records.description: The number of rows containing data in the data store.

size.description: The size that the data store occupies (defined in bytes).

maxSize.description: The maximum size of the data store (defined in bytes).

teamId.description: The unique numeric ID of the team whose data stores will be retrieved.

datastructureId.description: The unique numeric ID of the data structure related to the data store.

delete.description: Deletes a data store with a given ID and returns the ID as the response.

parameters.name: confirmed
parameters.description: This parameter confirms the deletion if a data store is included in at least one scenario. Confirmation is required because the scenario will stop working without the data store. If the parameter is not sent or is set to `false` an error code is returned and the resource is not deleted.

parameters.name: teamId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the team whose data stores will be retrieved.

sortables.name: pg[sortBy]
sortables.description: The value that will be used to sort returned entities by.

get.description: Retrieves details of a data store with a given ID.

parameters.name: dataStoreId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the data store. It can be retrieved from the `/data-stores` endpoint.

parameters.name: cols[]
parameters.description: This parameter allows you to specify the group of values to return. For instance, you can retrieve only the IDs of data stores for a team with a given ID. Besides, this parameter enables you to get more details than can be retrieved from the main request with only the teamId parameter.

id.description: The unique numeric ID of the data store. It can be retrieved from the `/data-stores` endpoint.

name.description: The data store name. The name does not need to be unique.

records.description: The number of rows containing data in the data store.

size.description: The size that the data store occupies (defined in bytes).

maxSize.description: The maximum size of the data store (defined in bytes).

teamId.description: The unique numeric ID of the team whose data stores will be retrieved.

datastructureId.description: The unique numeric ID of the data structure related to the data store.

patch.description: Updates properties of a data store with a given ID in a team with a given ID by passing new values in the request body. This endpoint cannot be used to update data included in the data store - for managing data use the `/data-stores/{dataStoreId}/data` endpoints. Any property that is not provided will be left unchanged. As the response, it returns all details of the updated data store including properties that were not changed.

name.description: The data store name. The name does not need to be unique.

datastructureId.description: The unique numeric ID of the data structure included in the data store. All data structures IDs for a given team can be retrieved from the `/data-structures` endpoint.

maxSizeMB.description: The maximum size of the data store (defined in MB).

parameters.name: dataStoreId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the data store. It can be retrieved from the `/data-stores` endpoint.

parameters.name: teamId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the team related to the data store.

name.description: The data store name. The name does not need to be unique.

records.description: The number of rows containing data in the data store.

size.description: The size that the data store occupies (defined in bytes).

maxSize.description: The maximum size of the data store (defined in bytes).

teamId.description: The unique numeric ID of the team whose data stores will be retrieved.

datastructureId.description: The unique numeric ID of the data structure related to the data store.

dataStoreId.name: dataStoreId
dataStoreId.description: The unique numeric ID of the data store. It can be retrieved from the `/data-stores` endpoint.

teamId.name: teamId
teamId.description: The unique numeric ID of the team whose data stores will be retrieved.

teamIdRequired.name: teamId
teamIdRequired.description: The unique numeric ID of the team related to the data store.

cols.name: cols[]
cols.description: This parameter allows you to specify the group of values to return. For instance, you can retrieve only the IDs of data stores for a team with a given ID. Besides, this parameter enables you to get more details than can be retrieved from the main request with only the teamId parameter.

get.description: Retrieves a list of the records from a data store with a given ID.

parameters.name: dataStoreId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the data store. It can be retrieved from the `/data-stores` endpoint.

parameters.name: pg[limit]
parameters.description: The numeric value of maximum entities to return.

parameters.name: pg[offset]
parameters.description: The numeric value of entities you want to skip before getting entities you need.

post.description: Creates a new record in a data store with a given ID and returns all record details.

key.description: The unique key of the data store record. If no key is provided, it will be automatically generated.

data.description: The data of the data store record. The structure strictly depends on the included data structure. If no data is provided, in response the values will be set to null.

parameters.name: dataStoreId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the data store. It can be retrieved from the `/data-stores` endpoint.

delete.description: Deletes a given set of records from a data store with a given ID.

oneOf.description: The array of record keys to delete.
This parameter allows to delete all records without defining all keys but also gives the possibility to exclude from deleting records with the specified keys.

parameters.name: dataStoreId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the data store. It can be retrieved from the `/data-stores` endpoint.

parameters.name: confirmed
parameters.description: This parameter confirms the deletion of records in case all records are deleted at once. If in such case the parameter is not sent or is set to `false` an error code is returned and the resource is not deleted.

limit.name: pg[limit]
limit.description: The numeric value of maximum entities to return.

put.description: Updates a data store record with a given key by passing new values in the request body. It replaces the entire resource with the new values. As the response, it returns all details of the updated data.

parameters.name: dataStoreId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the data store. It can be retrieved from the `/data-stores` endpoint.

parameters.name: dataStoreRecordKey
parameters.description: The key of the data store record. It can be retrieved from the `/data-stores/{dataStoreId}/data` endpoint.

patch.description: Updates a data store record with a given key by passing new values in the request body. Any property that is not provided will be left unchanged. As the response, it returns all details of the updated data including properties that were not changed.

parameters.name: dataStoreId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the data store. It can be retrieved from the `/data-stores` endpoint.

parameters.name: dataStoreRecordKey
parameters.description: The key of the data store record. It can be retrieved from the `/data-stores/{dataStoreId}/data` endpoint.

dataStoreRecordKey.name: dataStoreRecordKey
dataStoreRecordKey.description: The key of the data store record. It can be retrieved from the `/data-stores/{dataStoreId}/data` endpoint.

get.description: Retrieves a collection of all data structures for a team with a given ID. Returned data structures are sorted by name, with the most recently created data structures appearing first.

parameters.name: teamId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the team whose data structures will be retrieved.

parameters.name: cols[]
parameters.description: This parameter allows you to specify the group of values to return. For instance, you can retrieve only the IDs of data structures for a team with a given ID. Besides, this parameter enables you to get more details than can be retrieved from the main request with only the teamId parameter, such as the data structure specification and whether the strict option is enabled.

parameters.name: pg[sortBy]
parameters.description: The value that will be used to sort returned entities by.

parameters.name: pg[offset]
parameters.description: The numeric value of entities you want to skip before getting entities you need.

parameters.name: pg[sortDir]
parameters.description: The sorting order. It accepts the ascending and descending direction specifiers.

parameters.name: pg[limit]
parameters.description: The numeric value of maximum entities to return.

post.description: Creates a new data structure with parameters passed in the request body. As the response, it returns all details of the created data structure including its full specification.

teamId.description: The unique numeric ID of the team in which a data structure will be created.

name.description: The data structure name. The name does not need to be unique.

strict.description: Refers to the "Strict" option available for data structures in the Integromat platform interface. If set to **true**, the data structure will be compared to the structure of the payload and if the payload contains extra items not specified in the data structure, the payload will be rejected.

spec.description: Defines the data structure specifications including all related options. The specification structure depends on the chosen data types.

dataStructureIdRequired.name: dataStructureId
dataStructureIdRequired.description: The unique numeric ID of the data structure. It can be retrieved from the `/data-structures` endpoint.

patch.description: Updates a data structure with a given ID by passing new values in the request body. Any property that is not provided will be left unchanged. As the response, it returns all details of the updated data structure including properties that were not changed.

name.description: The unique numeric ID of the team in which a data structure will be created.

strict.description: Refers to the "Strict" option available for data structures in the Integromat user interface. If set to **true**, the data structure will be compared to the structure of the payload and if the payload contains extra items not specified in the data structure, the payload will be rejected.

spec.description: Defines the data structure specifications including all related options. The specification structure depends on the chosen data types. All properties correspond to the options visible in the Integromat interface.

parameters.name: dataStructureId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the data structure. It can be retrieved from the `/data-structures` endpoint.

delete.description: Deletes a data structure with a given ID and returns the ID as the response.

parameters.name: dataStructureId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the data structure. It can be retrieved from the `/data-structures` endpoint.

parameters.name: confirmed
parameters.description: This parameter confirms the deletion if a data structure is included in at least one scenario. Confirmation is required because the scenario will stop working without the data structure. If the parameter is not sent or is set to `false` an error code is returned and the resource is not deleted.

post.description: Creates a clone of the data structure with a given ID in the original or specified team. As the response, it returns all details of the cloned data structure including its full specification.

name.description: The cloned data structure name. The name does not need to be unique.

targetTeamId.description: The team in which the cloned data structure will be saved. If the target team is not specified, the cloned data structure will be saved in the original team.

parameters.name: dataStructureId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the data structure. It can be retrieved from the `/data-structures` endpoint.

get.description: Get a list of devices of a given team.

parameters.name: assigned
parameters.description: true = devices with scenarioId; false = devices without scenarioId - this filter only affects the trigger scope

parameters.name: viewForScenarioId
parameters.description: Devices assigned to the scenario and not assigned devices. If this parameter is set assigned parameter is ignored.

get.description: The ID can be id or udid.

delete.description:
Errors:
IM004 - Confirmation required (error with metadata) - needs confirmation
IM405 - Device can't be deleted because it contains messages in queue (error with metadata) - needs confirmation
IM005 - Device is locked by a running scenario and thus can't be deleted

post.description: Required scope: devices:write

get.description: Required scope: devices:read

parameters.name: pg[sortBy]
parameters.description: The value that will be used to sort returned entities by.

parameters.name: pg[offset]
parameters.description: The numeric value of entities you want to skip before getting entities you need.

parameters.name: pg[sortDir]
parameters.description: The sorting order. It accepts the ascending and descending direction specifiers.

parameters.name: pg[limit]
parameters.description: The numeric value of maximum entities to return.

delete.description:
"ids" and "all" can no be used together
"ids" or "all" has to be set
"exceptIds" is possible to use only with "all"
It could happen, that some incoming messages are deleted and others not. In this case, the API returns a successful status code, and the response additionally contains an error object with a error description.

error.name: APIError
error.message: Some of the incoming messages could not be deleted because they are being processed right now.

delete.description:
"ids" and "all" can no be used together

It could happen, that some incoming messages are deleted and others not. In this case, the API returns a successful status code, and the response additionally contains an error object with a error description.

get.description: Required scope: devices:read
List incomplete executions of a scenario.

delete.description:
"ids" and "all" can no be used together
"ids" or "all" has to be set
"exceptIds" is possible to use only with "all"
if "all" is used the query parameter "scenarioId" must be set
It could happen, that some executions are deleted and others not. In this case, the API returns a successful status code, and the response additionally contains an error object with a error description.

error.name: APIError
error.message: Some of the executions could not be deleted because they are being processed right now.

organizationFeatures.title: Allow access to internal IP addresses from scenarios (do not turn on if you don't know what you're doing!)
organizationFeatures.name: local_access

get.description: Default language is used from user settings.

userEmailNotifications.name: Warning in scenario run
userEmailNotifications.description: Warnings encountered by your scenarios that need your attention, such as failure to connect with your apps and services.

userEmailNotifications.name: Errors in scenario run
userEmailNotifications.description: Notifications about errors encountered by specific modules in your scenarios that keep your workflows from running smoothly.

userEmailNotifications.name: Scenario deactivation
userEmailNotifications.description: Get notified when your scenario gets deactivated due to critical issues such as multiple consecutive errors.

get.description: Retrieves a collection of all hooks for a team with a given ID. Returned hooks are sorted by the name, with the most recently created hooks appearing first.

parameters.name: teamId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the team whose hooks will be retrieved.

parameters.name: typeName
parameters.description: The hook type. Two native Integromat hook types are `gateway-webhook` and `gateway-mailhook`.

parameters.name: assigned
parameters.description: This parameter specifies if the hook is assigned to a scenario. If set to **true**, the request will return only the hooks which the `scenarioId` value is not set to null.

parameters.name: viewForScenarioId
parameters.description: This parameter shows only the hooks that can be used by a scenario with a specific ID, which means hooks that are not assigned to another scenario yet and the hook that is already assigned to this scenario. This can be useful because Integromat allows assigning any hook to only one scenario. If this parameter is set the `assigned` parameter is ignored.

post.description: Creates a new hook with parameters passed in the request body. As the response, it returns all details of the created hook.

get.description: Retrieves all available properties of a hook with a given ID including hooks data.

parameters.name: hookId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the hook. It can be retrieved from the `/hooks` endpoint.

delete.description: Deletes a hook with a given ID and returns the ID as the response.

parameters.name: hookId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the hook. It can be retrieved from the `/hooks` endpoint.

parameters.name: confirmed
parameters.description: This parameter confirms the deletion if a hook is included in the scenario. Confirmation is required because the scenario will stop working without the hook. If the parameter is not sent or is set to `false` an error code is returned and the resource is not deleted.

patch.description: Updates a hook with a given ID by passing new values in the request body. Any property that is not provided will be left unchanged. As the response, it returns all details of the updated hook including properties that were not changed.

parameters.name: hookId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the hook. It can be retrieved from the `/hooks` endpoint.

get.description: Determines if a hook with a given ID is active and retrieves its properties that provide you with the address of the hook and inform if the hook is attached, what is its learning status, and if it was not used for a long time.

parameters.name: hookId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the hook. It can be retrieved from the `/hooks` endpoint.

post.description: Starts the process of learning the request body structure by a hook with a given ID. When you send to the hook address a request with data in its body, you can use this endpoint to force the hook to start determining the payload data structure which will later be suggested in the scenario as the output of the hook. The data structure learning process also starts automatically when a new hook is created and stops once the data structure is determined. If you want to stop this process, you can use the `POST \hooks\{hookId}\learn-stop` request.

parameters.name: hookId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the hook. It can be retrieved from the `/hooks` endpoint.

post.description: Stops the process of learning the request body structure by a hook with a given ID. When you send to the hook address a request with data in its body, you can use `POST /hooks/{hookId}/learn-start` to force the hook to start determining the payload data structure which will later be suggested in the scenario as the output of the hook. The data structure learning process also starts automatically when a new hook is created and stops once the data structure is determined. You can use this endpoint to stop the learning process at any time.

parameters.name: hookId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the hook. It can be retrieved from the `/hooks` endpoint.

post.description: Enables a disabled hook with a given ID. Newly created hooks are enabled by default which means they are ready to accept data. In response, this endpoint returns the confirmation that the hook was successfully enabled.

parameters.name: hookId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the hook. It can be retrieved from the `/hooks` endpoint.

post.description: Disables a hook with a given ID. Newly created hooks are enabled by default which means they are ready to accept data. The disabled hook does not accept any data. This endpoint can be useful, for instance, when you want to debug the scenario functionality. In response, this endpoint returns the confirmation that the hook was successfully disabled.

parameters.name: hookId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the hook. It can be retrieved from the `/hooks` endpoint.

post.description: Sets data for a hook with a given ID. Data differ depending on the hook type. It returns the confirmation if the connection was changed (true) or not (false).

parameters.name: hookId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the hook. It can be retrieved from the `/hooks` endpoint.

parameters.name: hookId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the hook. It can be retrieved from the `/hooks` endpoint.

parameters.name: pg[sortBy]
parameters.description: The value that will be used to sort returned entities by.

parameters.name: pg[offset]
parameters.description: The numeric value of entities you want to skip before getting entities you need.

parameters.name: pg[sortDir]
parameters.description: The sorting order. It accepts the ascending and descending direction specifiers.

parameters.name: pg[limit]
parameters.description: The numeric value of maximum entities to return.

delete.description:
"ids" and "all" can no be used together
"ids" or "all" has to be set
"exceptIds" is possible to use only with "all"
It could happen, that some incoming messages are deleted and others not. In this case, the API returns a successful status code, and the response additionally contains an error object with a error description.

error.name: APIError
error.message: Some of the incoming messages could not be deleted because they are being processed right now.

parameters.name: hookId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the hook. It can be retrieved from the `/hooks` endpoint.

parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the hook. It can be retrieved from the `/hooks` endpoint.

get.description: Retrieves a collection of all notifications for the authenticated user. Returned notifications are sorted by name, with the most recently created notifications appearing first.

parameters.name: unreadOnly
parameters.description: If set to **true**, this parameter returns only the unread notifications.

parameters.name: imtZoneId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the Integromat zone. This parameter is required to retrieve notifications from the Integromat Next version. In other cases, it can be ignored. The IDs of the zones can be obtained from the `/enum/imt-zones` endpoint.

parameters.name: pg[sortBy]
parameters.description: The value that will be used to sort returned entities by.

parameters.name: pg[offset]
parameters.description: The numeric value of entities you want to skip before getting entities you need.

parameters.name: pg[sortDir]
parameters.description: The sorting order. It accepts the ascending and descending direction specifiers.

parameters.name: pg[limit]
parameters.description: The numeric value of maximum entities to return.

notifications.subject: Encountered error in Integration HTTP 3 scenario
Encountered error in Integration HTTP 3 scenario
The scenario Integration HTTP 3 has been stopped.
Encountered error in Integration HTTP scenario
Encountered error in Integration HTTP scenario
Encountered error in Integration HTTP scenario

parameters.name: imtZoneId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the Integromat zone. This parameter is required to retrieve notifications from the Integromat Next version. In other cases, it can be ignored. The IDs of the zones can be obtained from the `/enum/imt-zones` endpoint.

get.description: Retrieves details of a notification with a given ID.

parameters.name: notificationId
parameters.description: The unique string ID of the notification. It can be retrieved from the `/notifications` endpoint.

parameters.name: imtZoneId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the Integromat zone. This parameter is required to retrieve notifications from the Integromat Next version. In other cases, it can be ignored. The IDs of the zones can be obtained from the `/enum/imt-zones` endpoint.

notification.subject: Encountered error in Integration HTTP 3 scenario
notification.body:
Your scenario Integration HTTP 3 has encountered an error.

The scenario has not been paused and continues to run according to your settings. Nevertheless, you should pay attention to the issue.

  • Scenario: Integration HTTP 3
  • Organization: test team
  • Team: My Lab
  • Execution: d4f49055d5f44705b2aaf77a09547b77

Details:

  • Validation failed for 1 parameter(s).
  • Missing value of required parameter '{{!expect.json.label}}'.

If you have questions or need help, please contact us.

post.description: Marks a notification with a given ID as read and returns the IDs of the updated notifications.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: If set to **all**, this parameter marks all notifications as read.

parameters.name: imtZoneId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the Integromat zone. This parameter is required to retrieve notifications from the Integromat Next version. In other cases, it can be ignored. The IDs of the zones can be obtained from the `/enum/imt-zones` endpoint.

countryId - if not specified, it is used the identical to the request author
timezoneId - if not specified, it is used the identical to the request author
userOrgAdmin - if not specified, the request author is organization admin
license - if not specified, default value is used

get.description: Retrieves a collection of all apps available to the authenticated user.

parameters.name: all
parameters.description: If set to **true**, this parameter returns all apps available to all users. If set to **false**, it retrieves only the apps available to the authenticated user.

parameters.name: cols[]
parameters.description: This parameter allows you to specify the group of values to return. For instance, you may want to retrieve only the names of the available apps.

post.description: Creates a new app with parameters passed in the request body. As the response, it returns all details of the created app.

label.description: The label of the app visible in the scenario builder.

theme.description: The color of the app icon.

get.description: Retrieves a collection of all templates for a team with a given ID. Returned templates are sorted by name, with the most recently created templates appearing first.

parameters.name: teamId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the team whose templates will be retrieved.

parameters.name: public
parameters.description: This parameter indicates if the template is public which means that it was published and approved, and can be accessed by anyone.

parameters.name: usedApps[]
parameters.description: The array with the text IDs of the apps used in the templates. This parameter allows you to get only the templates containing specific apps.

parameters.name: cols[]
parameters.description: This parameter allows you to specify the group of values to return. For instance, you may want to retrieve only the IDs of the templates.

get.description: Retrieves all properties of a template with a given ID.

parameters.name: templateId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the private template. It can be retrieved from the `/templates` endpoint.

parameters.name: cols[]
parameters.description: This parameter allows you to specify the group of values to return. For instance, you may want to retrieve only the ID and name of the template.

patch.description: Updates a template with a given ID by passing new values in the request body. Any property that is not provided will be left unchanged. As the response, it returns all details of the updated template including properties that were not changed.

name.description: The new name of the template. The name does not need to be unique.

blueprint.description: The full blueprint of the scenario or template. It contains information about the general setup and all included apps and modules, and their settings.

parameters.name: templateId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the private template. It can be retrieved from the `/templates` endpoint.

parameters.name: templatePublicId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the public version of the approved template. It can be retrieved from the `/templates` endpoint as one of the following IDs: **publishedId** for all published templates that are waiting for approval or not, or **approvedId** for approved templates.

parameters.name: cols[]
parameters.description: This parameter allows you to specify the group of values to return. For instance, you may want to retrieve only the description of the templates.

delete.description: Deletes a template with a given ID and returns the ID as the response.

parameters.name: templateId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the private template. It can be retrieved from the `/templates` endpoint.

parameters.name: confirmed
parameters.description: This parameter confirms the deletion of the private or published templated. The public (approved) templates can only be deleted by the administrator.

get.description: Retrieves a blueprint of a template with a given ID.

parameters.name: templateId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the private template. It can be retrieved from the `/templates` endpoint.

parameters.name: forUse
parameters.description: If this parameter is set to true, it means the blueprint should be used for creating a scenario from the template.

parameters.name: templatePublicId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the public version of the approved template. It can be retrieved from the `/templates` endpoint as one of the following IDs: **publishedId** for all published templates that are waiting for approval or not, or **approvedId** for approved templates.

blueprint.description: The full blueprint of the scenario or template. It contains information about the general setup and all included apps and modules, and their settings.

expect.name: shareCookies
expect.label: Share cookies with other HTTP modules

parameters.name: handleErrors
parameters.label: Evaluate all states as errors (except for 2xx and 3xx )

parameters.name: templateId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the private template. It can be retrieved from the `/templates` endpoint.

post.description: Publishes a private template with a given ID. As the response, it returns all details of the template.

parameters.name: templateId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the private template. It can be retrieved from the `/templates` endpoint.

parameters.name: cols[]
parameters.description: This parameter allows you to specify the group of values to return. For instance, you may want to retrieve only the ID and name of the published template.

post.description: Requests approval of the published template with the given IDs of its private and published versions. As the response, it returns all details of the template.

parameters.name: templateId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the private template. It can be retrieved from the `/templates` endpoint.

parameters.name: templatePublicId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the public version of the approved template. It can be retrieved from the `/templates` endpoint as one of the following IDs: **publishedId** for all published templates that are waiting for approval or not, or **approvedId** for approved templates.

parameters.name: cols[]
parameters.description: This parameter allows you to specify the group of values to return. For instance, you may want to retrieve only the ID and name of the template you requested approval for.

get.description: Retrieves a collection of all public (approved) templates. Returned templates are sorted by name, with the most recently created templates appearing first.

parameters.name: includeEn
parameters.description: If this parameter is set to true, it means English templates should be included in the response. This is relevant only if the user's language is not English.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the template. This parameter allows limiting returned results to the names of the templates.

parameters.name: usedApps[]
parameters.description: The array with the text IDs of the apps used in the templates. This parameter allows you to get only the templates containing specific apps.

parameters.name: cols[]
parameters.description: This parameter allows you to specify the group of values to return. For instance, you may want to retrieve only the IDs of the public templates.

parameters.name: pg[sortBy]
parameters.description: The value that will be used to sort returned entities by.

parameters.name: pg[offset]
parameters.description: The numeric value of entities you want to skip before getting entities you need.

parameters.name: pg[sortDir]
parameters.description: The sorting order. It accepts the ascending and descending direction specifiers.

parameters.name: pg[limit]
parameters.description: The numeric value of maximum entities to return.

parameters.name: templateUrl
parameters.description: The unique URL of the public (approved) template consisting of the template ID and name. It can be retrieved from the `/templates/public` endpoint.

parameters.name: templatePublicId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the public version of the approved template. It can be retrieved from the `/templates` endpoint as one of the following IDs: **publishedId** for all published templates that are waiting for approval or not, or **approvedId** for approved templates.

parameters.name: cols[]
parameters.description: This parameter allows you to specify the group of values to return. For instance, you may want to retrieve only information about the apps used in the template.

parameters.name: templateUrl
parameters.description: The unique URL of the public (approved) template consisting of the template ID and name. It can be retrieved from the `/templates/public` endpoint.

parameters.name: templatePublicId
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the public version of the approved template. It can be retrieved from the `/templates` endpoint as one of the following IDs: **publishedId** for all published templates that are waiting for approval or not, or **approvedId** for approved templates.

blueprint.description: The full blueprint of the scenario or template. It contains information about the general setup and all included apps and modules, and their settings.

expect.name: shareCookies

parameters.name: handleErrors
parameters.label: Evaluate all states as errors (except for 2xx and 3xx )

preferences.label: Use Cases
preferences.description: Get new Integromat use cases delivered to your inbox.

preferences.label: Product Updates
preferences.description: Product and feature updates including new releases and important changes.

preferences.label: App Updates
preferences.description: Get notified about new apps and services as they become available, as well as changes in the existing apps.

preferences.label: Events and Webinars
preferences.description: Get notified about Integromat events and webinars including demos, discussions and community events.

preferences.label: Offers and Promotions
preferences.description: Latest promotions and discounts delivered to your inbox.

preferences.label: Partnerships
preferences.description: Emails with exclusive information for Integromat partners such as partner updates and resources.

preferences.label: Academy
preferences.description: Receive the latest content from Integromat Academy including videos, tutorials and educational events.

preferences.label: Blog and Newsletter
preferences.description: Get the latest advice, resources and updates on all things Integromat and no-code automation.

native.label: Deactivation
native.description: Get notified when your scenario gets deactivated due to critical issues such as multiple consecutive errors.

native.label: Warnings
native.description: Warnings encountered by your scenarios that need your attention, such as failure to connect with your apps and services.

native.label: Errors
native.description: Notifications about errors encountered by specific modules in your scenarios that keep your workflows from running smoothly.

marketing.label: Tips For Success
marketing.description: Organization-specific emails to help you succeed with Integromat and make the most of your subscription.
